comment_text:
Hi! Dr. Chris Alipio, through the Acute Psychiatric Unit of Amang Rodriguez Memorial Medical Center in Marikina, offers FREE consultation on weekdays. Since the clinic is government-funded and -run, you would have to line up and secure a slot. Otherwise, you could also set an appointment for consultation in his private clinic in Tandang Sora, Quezon City for a fee. (I've been going to ARMMC since February and I only paid Php 100 for the OPD card. Lines are also bearable if you come early)
Other details here:
https://pinoymentalhealthblog.com/profile/
https://www.reddit.com/r/Philippines/comments/7e8loi/free_psychiatry_clinic_in_marikina_an_update/

Dr. Robin Velasco from @heilenwellness. 💛
wow thanks for this ❤

If y'all don't want to talk to a person first, try visiting La Mesa Ecopark near Commonwealth Avenue, Quezon City. Only PHP20 entrance fee if you have a student ID (40-50php regular fee). The park is so huge it has horses, a lake, a koi pond, swimming pools, and an orchid garden!!! Lots of trees and quiet spaces too. 👽 You can also visit the Facebook post (dated March 5, 2018) of the UP Diliman University Student Council where they posted their Mental Health directory for more resources (also available at tinyurl.com/USC-MHdirectory). 🐢
Here >>>>> @healingmindsph ✨❤️
@theartidote @jovaferreyra
Dra. Cuadro at The Medical City Ortigas. 1031 MATI bldg.

Anonymous recommendation: “Re therapist in Manila: Viola Torres of UP Center for Women's and Gender Studies in Diliman, QC. She accepts walk-in clients but, to be sure, try to come by and agree on a schedule with her. She's there every Tuesday and Thursday, from 2-6pm. I worked with her from 2012-2015. She helped me recover from depression after I was severely abused by a former SO. She is also now the therapist of my current partner.”

Anonymous recommendation: “Hello! I’m from Manila and my therapist is Dra. Maricar Fajardo (iambigthink@gmail.com) she is based in Makati/Taguig and i’ve been under her care for about over a year. She’s very easy to get along with, especially if you’re a young adult or a teen. Honestly, she’s helped me a lot and I wouldn’t be alive anymore if it weren’t for her.”

Anonymous recommendation: “Hi! I’d like to recommend Dr. Marie Pearl Reyes. She has clinic sessions in the Alabang area and I believe in Pasay as well. She’s actually the 2nd psychiatrist I’ve had. I decided to transfer to her after having an underwhelming experience with my previous doctor, and I think it was one of the best decisions I ever made. She can help you in ways you won’t even think are possible and she’s very patient and understanding and non-judgmental. I highly recommend her. 🙂”

Anonymous recommendation: “Hello!
I have not been in any therapy etc but I studying my Master’s degree in Psychology and one of my professors is simply the best — Dr. Constantine Della. You can easily google him. He’s a really good psychiatrist & therapist, and he’s really passionate about his work. He has lots of clinics but I think most of the time he’s in Philippine General Hospital. 😊”
In Bacolod City, Dr Jocelyn Gayares is a really good child and adolescent counselor.

Submitted: "Hey there. I’m recommending Dr. Karina Perez from Philippine General Hospital. It’s a public hospital located in Manila City but definitely offers the best evaluation and assessment. Doctors are mostly from University of the Philippines."

submission: "Hi! In line with this, I'm recommending Dr. Marie Pearl Lei Reyes of Protacio Hospital. A paychiatrist who has a warm and welcoming charisma. She's very nice.

Other one is also my neuropsychiatrist, Dr. Alejandro F. Diaz of San Juan de Dios Hospital / St. Lukes / UST Hospital.

Yes I've been through 2 doctors because of changes in my sched as I started working and shifting work. But I've had a very nice exp with the 2 professionals."

Submitted recommendation: “Hi, I would like to recommend RCW Foundation in Quezon City, they have a great team of therapists and life coaches. The Founder, Harriet Hormillosa, helped me deal with a lot of childhood hurts and traumas. Contact details are 4266832 or hhhneh@yahoo.com”
